content: So this is AI village. It takes the latest and best large language models like cloud 3.7 sonnet, cloud opus 4. And the things that they've been able to achieve are kind of impressive. These agents were able to raise thousands of dollars for various charities. They pulled off a first ever AI organized event. title: AI Village is getting scary
author: Wes Roth

key_facts: AI Village launched on April 9, 2025, with four AI agents given a virtual Linux computer and group chat access.
The initial goal was to raise money for charity, specifically Helen Keller International.
Claude 3.7 Sonnet created a Twitter account and used ChatGPT to generate a profile picture in Studio Ghibli style.
Agents collaborated via group chat and shared documents using tools like Google Drive.
Human viewers could interact with the agents, sometimes suggesting unhelpful ideas such as starting an OnlyFans channel.
GPT5, Grok 4, Gemini 2.5 Pro, and Claude Opus 4.1 were added to the project in August 2025.
Each agent maintains its own memory bank to persist information across sessions.
The new season's goal is to complete as many video games as possible within one week.
AI agents can now autonomously perform tasks that take humans up to 2 hours to complete.
The AI Village project is non-profit and supported by donations from individuals like Daniel Kotalo.
Agents have successfully created fundraising pages, run merch stores, and posted on forums like the Effective Altruism forum.
A benchmark called the vending machine experiment tests AI models' ability to run a simulated business.
In the vending machine benchmark, Grok 4 achieved a net profit of $4,694.15 from an initial $500 investment.
Claude 3.7 Sonnet had a best performance of $2,200 but also recorded negative results in some runs.
Human participants outperformed most models except Grok 4 and GPT5 in the vending machine benchmark.
key_opinions: Humans are not to be trusted when interacting with AI agents due to misleading suggestions.
The current trend in AI progress is accelerating faster than previously assumed.
The red line showing faster improvement reflects more accurate recent trends compared to older data.
If this acceleration continues, AI may achieve month-long task completion by 2027.
Recursive self-improvement by AI agents could trigger an intelligence explosion.
AI Village provides a more visceral and understandable demonstration of progress than abstract charts.
Many people still dismiss AI progress despite measurable improvements in real-world tasks.
The gap between AGI and superintelligence may be very short if automated AI research accelerates development.
Early efforts by AI agents appear clumsy, but their performance has improved significantly over four months.
The current pace of advancement suggests we are entering a transformative phase in AI history.
The idea of AI-driven recursive improvement is no longer science fiction but emerging reality.
Progress in AI capabilities is happening faster than most public discourse acknowledges.
The AI Village project serves as a powerful benchmark for tracking real-world AI agency.
The shift toward autonomous long-horizon task execution marks a critical inflection point.
We may soon reach a point where AI can do the equivalent of a full human workday in a single prompt.
key_datapoints: As of August 13, 2025, Grok 4 achieved a net profit of $4,694.15 from a $500 initial investment.
Claude 3.7 Sonnet raised nearly $1,500 for Helen Keller International.
The vending machine benchmark shows GPT40 lost money, ending with less than $500.
Gemini 2.0 Pro also ended with a net loss in the vending machine experiment.
Claude 3.7 Sonnet’s minimum net worth during runs was negative, indicating losses in some trials.
AI agents can now autonomously complete tasks taking humans up to 2 hours.
Task duration capability doubles every 7 months according to older data (orange line).
Recent trends suggest doubling every 4 months (red line), implying faster progress.
Projected timeline: AI capable of 10-hour tasks by 2026, full-day tasks by 2027, and month-long tasks by 2027 or 2029.
The AI Village project has been live for less than 4 months as of August 2025.
GPT5 and Grok 4 went live on the same day as the update to the transcript.
Human participants ranked fourth in the vending machine benchmark.
Six models—including Grok 4, GPT5, Claude Opus 4, and humans—consistently made a profit across all runs.
The average time horizon for AI tasks has increased from 30 seconds (2022) to 2 hours (2025).
